params.feeTokensToAdd: The addresses of the tokens which are now considered fee tokens and can be used to calculate fees.
params.feeTokensToRemove: The addresses of the tokens which are no longer considered feeTokens.

params.priceUpdatersToAdd: The addresses of the priceUpdaters that are now allowed to send fee updates.
params.priceUpdatersToRemove: The addresses of the priceUpdaters that are no longer allowed to send fee updates.

convertTokenAmount(address,uint256,addre.details: this function assumes that no more than 1e59 dollars are sent as payment. If more is sent, the multiplication of feeTokenAmount and feeTokenValue will overflow. Since there isn't even close to 1e59 dollars in the world economy this is safe.

params.destChainSelector: The destination chain to get the price for.

returns._0: gasPrice The encoded gasPrice for the given destination chain ID.
The tokens set as fee tokens.

params.destChainSelector: The destination chain to get the gas price for.
params.token: The source token to get the price for.

returns.gasPriceValue: The price of gas in 1e18 dollars per base unit.
returns.tokenPrice: The price of the feeToken in 1e18 dollars per base unit.

params.token: The token to get the price for.

returns._0: tokenPrice The tokenPrice for the given token.

params.tokens: The tokens to get prices for.

returns._0: tokenPrices The tokenPrices for the given tokens.

params.token: The token to get the price for.

returns._0: tokenPrice The tokenPrice for the given token if it exists and is valid.

acceptOwnership().notice: Allows an ownership transfer to be completed by the recipient.

applyFeeTokensUpdates(address[],address[.notice: Add and remove tokens from feeTokens set.

applyPriceUpdatersUpdates(address[],addr.notice: Adds new priceUpdaters and remove existing ones.

convertTokenAmount(address,uint256,addre.notice: Convert a given token amount to target token amount.

getDestinationChainGasPrice(uint64).notice: Get an encoded `gasPrice` for a given destination chain ID. The 224-bit result encodes necessary gas price components. On L1 chains like Ethereum or Avax, the only component is the gas price. On Optimistic Rollups, there are two components - the L2 gas price, and L1 base fee for data availability. On future chains, there could be more or differing price components. PriceRegistry does not contain chain-specific logic to parse destination chain price components.

getFeeTokens().notice: Get the list of fee tokens.

getPriceUpdaters().notice: Get the list of price updaters.

getTokenAndGasPrices(address,uint64).notice: Gets the fee token price and the gas price, both denominated in dollars.

getTokenPrice(address).notice: Get the `tokenPrice` for a given token.

getTokenPrices(address[]).notice: Get the `tokenPrice` for an array of tokens.

getValidatedTokenPrice(address).notice: Get the `tokenPrice` for a given token, checks if the price is valid.

transferOwnership(address).notice: Allows an owner to begin transferring ownership to a new address.

updatePrices(((address,uint224)[],(uint6.notice: Update the price for given tokens and gas prices for given chains.

documentation.text:
@dev The gas price per unit of gas for a given destination chain, in USD with 18 decimals.
 Multiple gas prices can be encoded into the same value. Each price takes {Internal.GAS_PRICE_BITS} bits.
 For example, if Optimism is the destination chain, gas price can include L1 base fee and L2 gas price.
 Logic to parse the price components is chain-specific, and should live in OnRamp.
 @dev Price of 1e18 is 1 USD. Examples:
     Very Expensive:   1 unit of gas costs 1 USD                  -> 1e18
     Expensive:        1 unit of gas costs 0.1 USD                -> 1e17
     Cheap:            1 unit of gas costs 0.000001 USD           -> 1e12

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (uint256) pure returns (struct Internal.TimestampedPackedUint224 memory[] memory)

documentation.text:
@notice Get the staleness threshold.
 @return stalenessThreshold The staleness threshold.

statements.documentation:
Example:
 fromTokenAmount:   1e18      // 1 ETH
 ETH:               2_000e18
 LINK:              5e18
 return:            1e18 * 2_000e18 / 5e18 = 400e18 (400 LINK)

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (struct EnumerableSet.AddressSet storage pointer) view returns (address[] memory)

documentation.text:
@notice Get the list of fee tokens.
 @return The tokens set as fee tokens.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (struct EnumerableSet.AddressSet storage pointer) view returns (address[] memory)

documentation.text:
@notice Get the list of price updaters.
 @return The price updaters.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (struct EnumerableSet.AddressSet storage pointer,address) view returns (bool)

documentation.text: @notice Require that the caller is the owner or a fee updater.

@notice The PriceRegistry contract responsibility is to store the current gas price in USD for a given destination chain,
 and the price of a token in USD allowing the owner or priceUpdater to update this value.
